FXBCTWwq9m_-hly900nH8Q.text: Their truffle egg cup with toast is delightful!  I love retro feel this shop has and I will definitely dine here again!

4QZdDzZCiHHXe_t1pR5cOA.text: I love the fresh, healthy and tasty food here. Although based on the fast-food concept there are charming rough edges - on my last visit the sweet potato felafel wrap turned out no to be available (after a wait of about 12 minutes). They offered me a replacement and gave me a refund. I love their minted apple juices.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom

JiGMZhcXKoUhdctvuaTTfQ.text: tasty lunch food (£20 for two people) good portion size. seating available, or takeaway to eat ar your desk.

UF0bR7i6o0n0hPm2iQf4Xw.text: Leon is a fantastic restaurant. It's the answer to all my prayers: a fast food restaurant that won't actually give you a heart attack. Meals are super-cheap and come with plentiful salads and yoghurt. The chilli with rice and Moroccan meatballs with yoghurt are an especially tasty treat. There's also a nice selection of deserts and chocolate for afters. As it's fast food, it's also super-quick, so is ideal if you're heading off to the theatre and are in need of speed. It's also nice to see a healthy restaurant which features some meat and isn't entirely veggie based. The only thing about this one is why they insist on giving you table service when you're eating in  at the other Leons you just take it from the counter and it's even quicker.

2ug8c5UkXj4mcRwYT_qFmw.text: Three ladies in search of dessert are stupidly hard to please in London. All we needed was something sweet. Where were the all-night ice cream parlours? Pining for NY's Coldstone Creamery, I traipsed round a few streets and racked my brains for somewhere sweet and swish, to no avail. I love Leon for its Power Smoothies and Superfood salads in the daytime, but I thought it might be worth a shot at 9pm  and glimpsing the menu, my trio, desparately seeking pudding, thought we had hit upon a gem. The evening menu looks simply sumptuous and so we ordered three pecan pies. Hurrah! Sticky nutty delight  or so we thought. Nope, all gone. Home-made lemonade? Sold out. Hot chocolate? No such luck. We begrudgingly settled on coffees and chocolate milkshakes, and these were served and enjoyed  great quality, very tasty, if a little pricey [almost £5 for a shake]. We came to pay so we could make a hasty sashay off to Charing Cross and our trains  but this proved to be the most trying process of all. The young lady who served us was slow, rather rude and incapable of simple arithmetic. She was reluctant to let us pay the bill in two parts, refused cash, left us halfway through the transaction and had to ask repeatedly the sum we wished to pay! This little episode won't put me off Leon for good  but it might make me think twice about visiting in the evening. Three stars because the decor is divine and the food fabulous, but the service was nothing short of very poor on this occasion.

KEoWLsE6dD4tyrctkaJg7g.text: It's quite an efficient operation, a bit like fast food - you go up to the counter, order, and they hand you a prepackaged box of hot food or salads or a wrap. I tried the Moroccan Meatballs, described as lamb with Moroccan herbs and spices cooked down in a plum tomato sauce with aioli and a sprinkling of parsley and mint. There were also nuts sprinkled on top, as well as brown rice and coleslaw with cabbage, carrots, and peas (thankfully I could not detect any mayonnaise). The flavors were complex and quite delicious, with a lot of different and interesting textures, and it was nice to have a warm lunch that I could get instantaneously and eat in about half an hour.

GHklqhztSZ1yAmfvJn-nxg.text: Since my nearby hotel room was not ready for occupancy upon my arrival in London I decided to take a walk on The Strand and came across Leon around lunch time.  It was very busy, so this was a good sign.  The menu of healthy foods is limited six lunch items plus two salads, additional side dishes and beverages.  I had the poached salmon wrap which was excellent and a brownie to go.  I was delighted to discover Leon and looked for other Leon's around London for lunch.  Very friendly staff, healthy foods and quick service.

-udZSyqTEAsZhW_S9c0Jiw.text: I really rate Leon, it's good value delicious food, I love the fact all their ingrediants are healthy, and recommend their cranberry pecan flapjack as it is almost too delicious. This isn't the most comfortable place to eat, but nice for grabbing lunch with a friend if you're lucky enough to get a table.

Wwur5SAiQCZtDdgKcCAA4A.text: Chain Review:Star 1 - Was the service good?I must have gone on an off day, but it appeared as though Leon was pretty grossly understaffed. As a result, I ended up waiting roughly 20 minutes for my Moroccan Meatball Box.  However, I was very promptly compensated with a free appetizer, which was nice.  Besides that, service appeared prompt, and it's nice to see that you can watch the chefs make your meal. Star Granted.Star 2 - How were the portions relative to the cost?Compared to your run of the mill fast food joint, Leon is expensive (10 GBP+ for a medium portioned meal), however, as is often the case, you get what you pay for.  I often describe Leon to friends as what a Whole Foods Markets take-away joint would look like.  The portions are a bit small, but the quality of the food brings in the star.Stars 3/4 - Did the food taste good?I was thoroughly impressed with the taste of my Moroccan Meatball box, and it was nice to see that the menu appears to rotate frequently, however, while the meatballs were great, the box was filled with what appeared to be pretty common fillers.  Disregarding the pulses and basic beans, I pretty much paid 10 pounds for some quality meatballs.  One star granted.Star 5 - Would you eat it every day if you could?I'm a huge fan of the growing healthy fast-food movement, and it's places like Leon that are really pioneering the shift in consumer perspectives.  While many of the menu items have some fillers and prices are high, I really could eat at Leon every day and be happy. Star Granted.

6jm2ZWKkHjNzRrypZNZ6dQ.text: Leon-Strand, very nice place to quick lunch. Pretty cheap price, nice location. But I can't say they serves very delicious food, it is not bad, but that's all.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. GOBI~ (i can't remember whole name)

QoDfwNly7fx6jQLXp6hv1A.text: I recently went here after a film with friends as it's something for everyone. The staff were very friendly and I was a bit shocked to find out the "Ve" symbol* means vegan! Now, there aren't many vegan options (the menu itself isn't large), but they are there and that's great! (I'm sure they could easily make a few vegetarian items vegan). I had the Moroccan Curry with brown rice and slaw and it was surprisingly nice! (Can you tell I'm weary on chain restaurants?) I also had a couple of waffle chips which were really good too.I'm glad to know I can safely go to Leon for a bite to eat and able to go along with friends without being a drag or just eating hummus.*Also menu symbols for vegetarian, wheat free, gluten free, low GI, low sat. fat and nuts. If you want nutritional information or other allergy ingredients, they are ALL listed on the website for each dish. Kudos to you Leon!

jdih4gX6fJt4L-mEUsmiPA.text: I don't go to Leon as regularly as I do other fast food establishments, because it is slightly out of my price range for fast food - however I'm always happy when I pop in. It's clear even though it describes itself as fast food it's food is fresh and freshly prepared. The thing I love about Leon is all it's little touches. While the food is uncomplicated but really yummy, the layout of the restaurant and all it's little touches are just adorable. I sometimes feel that you're really paying for the branded cups and napkins rather than the food, but it's so bright and colorful it's hard to complain. It's also great for us Veggies. It goes beyond a mushroom in a bun and offers good old Hallomi burgers with lovely touches such as a well toasted bun and amazing burger sauce. These little touches do make a difference. Always a win.

jB6uXn4aT0JkD3z0vxR59Q.text: Ideal for fast healthy food. I work not very far from the Strand restaurant so I decided yesterday to get some take away in Leon (I also like McDonald's or Subway but I'm on a diet...). I must say that I was very hungry and the quinoa and chicken salad I got was tasty and good. I will come back.

l_G9mR-CPF-dYDwCmqQW8Q.text: Great place, good prices and healthy !!Very nice place, different food, healthy and very tasty !!I had a dinner pot Thai Green Chicken Curry, and a Goji juice for less than 6£. Last time I just took a Ginger Steeper. Everything is PERFECT and very healthy !!!

kRlkhRcICy8M7bchhj0tkg.text: Went to this branch of Leon this weekend as we tried to go for a meal/drinks at Gordon's but it was insanely busy, so headed here instead. We ordered the one of the set menus for 23 quid and some wine to go with the meal. I liked the informal nature of the place; the food was good the service was friendly. The Halloumi pots were delicious but the flat bread arrived slightly cold. Other recommendations would definitely be to try the fresh slaw, Chicken & Chorizo Club & the sweet potato fallafal. This is a good place to go, if you fancy a meal that isn't too fussy and formal but also has some kind of substance/atmosphere to it. I would go back again for sure, more of a nice stopping place for food rather than a destination.

MwZxmiHTWr1S6wXwdKl72w.text: I guess you could call this the 'healthy fast food.' It comes out very quick, on a tray, in a box and you take it away and eat it. While the menu is great and flavours are good it does have that fast food feel to it - things that are supposed to be hot...aren't quite there, and there isn't that same sense of freshness.... Not bad though, i'm sure i'll be eating there a lot more in the future, just won't go calling it my favourite!

whMXjXJ2HyqW1BFaex5cdw.text: I'm not a fan of chains - as in of the more than one of them / food eateries variety! This was the second Leon I'd frequented after visiting the Spitalfields one and I have to say I'd return, if you're after a quick, simple, fast food meal of the healthy variety. I would recommend the Meatballs & rice meal deal, the hummus and flatbread and the Cloudy Apple and Mint juice and the fresh Lemonade are refreshing and delicious. The two occasions I've visited this branch, the service was quick and friendly and it's conveniently located on The Strand.

txdL9DcphagT_YiJJxgjFw.text: SInce starting a job on the Strand in September, eating in Leon has become one of my favourite things about being alive.Let me count the ways:One - I love the fact that the food is wholesome and so very very tasty.  I feel clean, pure, topped up with vitamins and FULL when I leave here.  That 'slaw would keep anyone reg'lar.Two - I love whoever does their design work.  Gorgeous retro stickers on takeaway items ('line caught fish', 'freedom food chicken' etc) and lovely menu covers.  I lust after their spin-off hardback cookbook, sucker that I am.  It's got super thick matt pages, lots of the aforementioned design and it smells goooood and inky.Three - Bring your own booze.Four - Mackerel Superfood SaladFive - Stacks of disposable cutlery conveniently placed near the door.  If, I don't know, you...say, had a homemade pasta salad for lunch and needed a fork, but got down the road and realised you didn't have one...I *reckon* you could easily steal one from here, plus a few more to take back to your office for other times when you forget cutlery.In conclusion: A lovely selection of genuinely healthy fast food, with proper fastfood service and signs/counter. Given that very specific brief, definitely as good as it gets!  Nothing like it anywhere else that I've lived.  This contributes to my current Londonlove.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom

fp7283LPSuQMqt_0gmBQgw.text: The grilled chicken salad is delicious! They have a good system here - fast service, friendly faces, and good, relatively healthy food. It is quite expensive for what it is, however, it's great as a once a month treat  & I will definitely be returning. I do think it's rude that they charge more for you to eat your salad in though...sort that out & I might go more than once a month!

DlfVBCZ6VOsxV4XLWRLwBQ.text: I frequent this Leon only because of the welcome smiles I receive upon arrival. I will be the first to admit I have never sampled their foods, but they can make a pretty mean cup of tea/coffee.Because of this I cannot give a large star rating, I will make sure to visit again when my stomach needs some filling and let you know, otherwise I love the staff.

AR6mwFuy-3yL9JtvaCUzyg.text: I still heart yelp. I'm still trying to eat my way through the delicious menu! I had the new dih which was beef meatballs and brown rice for only £3.99...I also ordered fresh slaw on the side (very nice) good work Leon!!!

V0cqlr_GeeX3ySTkMBhxrg.text: It's the healthiest and best tasting "fast" food I've ever had. The sweet potato falafel is to die for. Specials change all the time but I loved them all. Food is FULL of flavor. Breakfast options are equally delicious. Staff is super friendly and efficient. Coming to London is always such a stark reminder for me how much better they've done on quick, healthy tasty food compared to the junk in the US. Leon is one of my very favorite places to grab a bite.

Ct5ulx2eUqwpDd9J96SgYQ.text: As a former nutrition teacher, I cannot say that I'm a fan of fast food. However, I had 30 minutes to grab a quick bite the other day and I hopped into Leon on the Strand. I ordered the fish & chips expecting some fried greasy mess. Instead, I received deliciously seasoned waffle fries, a delicate filet of salmon, quinoa mixed with tarter sauce, and a bed of mesclun greens. I was very pleasantly surprised by this light and filling meal. I will definitely be returning :)

4AXJ4G3vT41s03njJuIwfw.text: Loved lamb kifta salad. Lemon chicken was fine, but nothing special. Would come back as it is a good fast healthy food option on in Strand.

QKpWwNAUkZDeU2EBbW0D8Q.text: Fan-bloody-tastic!I feel a little bit hurt that no-one had let on about Leon at dinner time... you don't love me anymore do you. Admit it.But I discovered it all on my own, and so glad I did. Come the evening, gone are the takeway box meals and queues, but replaced with tapas style sit down eating, with food served to your table. And BYO too? Huzzzzzzzah! You can imagine the quick dash in all directions for the nearest offie when we found that one out!As mentioned before; it's seriously good food here... it feels that much more wholesome and healthier, but I do suspect I'm being tricked somewhat. Especially if you eat as much as we did last night!I'm chuffed to bits that Leon is popping up across the city, long may they continue to fill my belly.

n52epVCi74aLpEANFxdqoQ.text: I ate in at Leon with a friend, and after a rocky start (staff weren't great at explaining how ordering/paying works) the food was wonderful. I had the hummus & flatbread, which was delicous, and a really good sized portion. I also had their sweet potato falafel which were lovely, and I'm now trying to find a recipe to make them at home.The only let down was the fish finger wrap. I found a huge bone in it, which meant I had to spit out my mouthful as subtley as possible. My friend remarked 'It tastes just like the McDonalds fillet of fish'. Having not tried the McDonalds version, I couldn't comment, but the fish was very dry and chewy.In all, I will definately go back to grab a quick bite. It's well priced, and you can walk out feeling healthy and environmentally friendly. No other fast food place can give you that!

b62YaGsT-4q6KfUVqgIMOg.text: It's not often that you go out for Fast food and find something that's not only tasty but also healthy, well balanced and reasonably priced. Leon seems to tick every box with a vengeance! The menu is very varied with a meditteranean twist so even fussy eaters and those with dietary issues are likely to find something to suit. The menu is also very appealing with items such as wraps, salads and hot foods available as well as the soup du jour and the odd special here and there. My last visit had a chicken laksa soup and Morrocan meatballs meal as the orders and spectacularly good they were too. The meatballs were beautifully cooked in a delicious sauce and a generous helping piled on top of brown rice with a fantastic coleslaw side. In its cardboard tray it didn't seem much but eating it soon proved that it was more substantial than it looked.The chicken laksa soup was an experiment as my partner loves hot (as in spicy) soup and was concerned that the laksa would likely be tamed down for Brit tastes. To her delight it wasn't. Rich, spicy, creamy ... everything a laksa should be and very tasty too.Barely room for dessert but the mini-knickerbocker glory with natural yoghurt, fresh fruit and compote went down a treat and I don't think my partner could have been separated from her chocolate tart.The Strand venue is spacious and the music non-intrusive, the decor bright and retro while still feeling warm and inviting. The staff were very helpful as well and it would have been a five star review had they not run out of the desserts we REALLY wanted

bRUd_JwXheiBjg5YO7hI3w.text: I love this place. I'd go every day if it wasn't so expensive! I've developed a pricey habit of going in for breakfast for a fab Blueberry boost (yoghurt, honey, blueberry and granola) and their drinks are very refreshing (try the lemonade).Yes, they do do lunch but it's quite pricey, so i'd recommend their pecan and cranberry flapjack - a perfect afternoon pick-me-up with a cuppa. Hide from the office and eat in, or eat at your desk and make your colleagues jealous!

P1FVszwocu1Oouh2stz4ZQ.text: Stopped in on way back to hotel to grab lunch to go. Got the sweet potato falafel and was not disappointed. This is a fast-food place, but food I had was a far cry from what I think of as fast food - food wasn't greasy or heavy. Instead it was healthy and satisfying. Happy I found this place!

5vVqv-MbriJzQNLCuz_YnA.text: I was here to see Kinky boots at the Adelphi. The tapas restaurant I really wanted to go to was a long wait. Ended up coming to Leon instead and as always, it was solid and good food. I like the concept and they have food from all over the world and it is quick. Got the Moroccan meatball which was good. The billionaires shortbread was just OK. Bought some chocolates for snacking later as well. Food itself is a 3 but rounding up for speed and convenience.

N-Bp_N5mdk2hQqbJZMn77A.text: Very tasty food served in plates (feels like homemade food), did not like most of their sandwiches tho (dry-weak meat taste presence).Pros for them for using Eco friendly materials in their packaging!

eIvXVbeEP2Cg1zxuVHtpcg.text: This place is great! I don't understand why it doesn't have more reviews. Food came out quickly, it was a good portion size and most importantly it was delicious. I got the Moroccan meatballs that came on a bed of rice with a  side salad. It was filling without making me feel sluggish after like most fast food. Rosemary water was a perfect addition.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom

Cbxm8uORQozxlpwdOabatg.text: If you're looking for fast, inexpensive, good food Leon is the place! Had ten minutes before hitting the Savoy for Dreamgirls and bought a grilled Halloumi wrap. Downed that delicious sammich in record time and made it before curtain. Bought a sweet chocolate shortbread for intermission too!

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. Half eaten grilled halloumi

QB4U23qjLGDk89ZydynKsA.text: This is a great place to come for a quick but good quality lunch. The staff are great and although the queues can sometimes be quite long they manage it well.It is a little bit more pricey than other lunch places in the area, but it feels like healthy comfort food and I particularly love the warm food on a cold day! The lemon chicken tagine is a new favourite.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. Chicken tagine

sA1x-JbPJKQ95vWcVX_zqQ.text: I generally love Leon, and what I wouldn't do to have one up in Newcastle!  My husband and I shared the Moroccan Meatballs Hot Box and the Chargrilled Chicken Hot Box with chili sauce.  The Meatballs are a classic, something we've ordered time and again and really enjoyed.  The chicken hot box had less going for it - nothing wrong with it, just a bit on the plain side, but very healthy and fresh with rice and slaw. I'd probably skip that in future in favor of the meatballs and curried dishes, as I think Leon do such a good job with those.  Their hummus is rather nice, and the crushed pea salad with its lovely minty flavor makes eating your veggies more enjoyable.  Wish the fries were a bit crispier and hotter, but they're probably baked, not fried.You get a good portion of healthy food for your money, and it's ready nice and quick!  Some things are better than others, but that's the same everywhere!

qvaIrr_AzEO0-or1ngWjbA.text: I'm a sucker for happy people and good customer service. Maybe it was because the two previous places were somewhat rude when we walked in but this place is just good all over. Food. Customer service. Ambience. Just what I needed for a good healthy breakfast. But don't be fooled it may be healthy but it is oh so delicious. I recommend this to anyone on the go but with a yearning for something tasty and healthy.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. Bigger portions than you expect from the picture.

EnsNalga03HvH1YrNHe2Eg.text: I like Leon, a chain of "fast food" places that now has outposts even at King's Cross and Heathrow me-thinks.I don't often go for full meals because I feel that the portions are pretty small.  Ha.  That made me sound like I EAT ALL THE THINGS ALL THE TIME.  But, well, maybe let's not dwell on that.  Instead, let's just say some of the great things:- I LOVE Leon's milkless "shakes".  Made with almond milk and sweetened with dates, they're small but a nice treat.  Chocolate is particularly "dessert"-y, but my favourite is the one blended with banana and tons of cinnamon- the "egg pots" are a brilliant idea, on top of being delicious.  A perfectly poached egg is served up in, well, a pot with options like stewed beans and truffled cheese.  A perfectly poached egg is a beautiful thing- the people who work there are SO friendly, but not annoyingly so.  Food is fast (I know, I know, it's *fast* food, but it actually _is_ here) and I like the chain's design aesthetic- I like that food options are marked not just with the standard v-for-veggie, but also you can see which items are gluten free, or have a low glycemic index- kale cesar.  Heck to the yes; get on that, gangAtop the cost-for-quantity point, I'll also agree with another reviewer who said that food isn't always piping hot.  I don't get the sense that it's pre-made (maybe it is?) but these points cost Leon the extra star.Yelp note: maybe I'm being nuts, but the savings for takeaway vs. eat in seemed considerable here.  Which is fine (I'll take that to go, plz!) but worth noting.

CIAzztDwcumg6507SFE1XA.text: It's not the cheapest lunch you can get but then you do get a huge portion.Their also the friendliest staff in the area and even when it gets busy try to make sure you get what you ordered quickly. A sucker for the seasonal special, but basically the whole menu is worth a try. Apparently they also do smaller portions so you don't have to feel so glutinous - you just need to ask :)

RU4w4fL2WojVaEpNRIluzg.text: Come here as often as I can. I like the Leon chain a lot : great food, fast friendly service and a nice clean place to eat in. My particular favourites are the Moroccan meatballs and Porridge of the God's with banana and chocolate. Yummy! Downsides: food is never warm enough, the portions are small and I think it's quite expensive for what it is.

fwJpawSWrEZzInG1yYz1Cw.text: overpriced for the service and food wasnt as tasty as i expected with small portion sizes

nv9Bsxn1K6UgHjrTWCxZog.text: I've decided that Leon is my favorite 'fast food' establishment in London. Why? Well, you know how everything at Pret tastes like ... Pret? Or how, when you walk past a Subway, you get a whiff of that unmistakable Subway smell? None of this happens at Leon. Nothing tastes the same; it's constantly evolving, changing, different. The ingredients are fresh and it tastes like healthy, clean eating (though there are naughty options too, when you feel up to it!).Leon tastes intelligent. And maybe it's the prosecco I've had tonight, but the menu isn't contrived and a lot of thought has been put into the flavors and the product. Their lemonade is the closest to the beloved lemonade of my home country, the US. Plus, as a on-off lactose intolerant individual, I'm a big fan of their non-milk milkshakes.A winner all around.

FkBD3yewhO3oABmBa0BuBw.text: Perfect for my celiac husband. Kids chose perfectly portioned kids meals. They like the morrocan meatballs and fish sticks. The full growns liked the green curry and satay chicken meals accompanied with brussel sprout salad. Fresh green peas and steamed broccoli accompanied the kids meals. Absolutely love this place. Wish we had one close to us.

G1QbpB1YTrvai3HE8PoppA.text: I do feel very blessed to work in an area where I'm so spoiled for lunch options and I feel I don't go to Leon's enough.  So many places offer healthy and tasty options but something about Leon's lures me in there when I want something that'll warm me up.  I love the variety of wraps and salads.  When I want a slightly bigger meal I'll go for the boxes.  For someone like me with food ADD, I do appreciate how they change around their menu all year round.  I think the hummous is just a okay.  The baked waffle fries are deeeelcious!  So good with less guilt!

otFF4FtDWVzFvufxiRbGaQ.text: A fast food culinary excursion. The portion size was generous and the menu diverse. The restaurant itself is clean and open, and the servers are polite and helpful. I had the meatballs and thought they were fantastic. Definitely surpassed my expectations for something easily labelled "fast-food."

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom. Meatballs

8MaXCmekShvuLHb2EcIZdQ.text: A pit stop rather than a dining destination.  It was busy and everywhere was littered with leftovers, we cleared our own space and focused on refuelling and moving on.

gI2b2g5-hOE7uUqI3DJpKA.text: Clean and easy atmosphere and friendly staff.  Love that the menu was straightforward and it was nice to have a healthy fast food option for a quick lunch in the area.

CeXAR--Gmz_6gfNS9bnrcw.text: Good food at a good price and, most importantly, it's served fast. I got the fish finger wrap and the fries. The fries aren't great. They're ok. The wrap was good. Not great. But it didn't cost much and did it's job of getting me full! Would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Leon - London, United Kingdom

GyOrlIzwggbdHOVSzJoEJQ.text: Great place to come for a cheap snack, particularly if you happen to be going to one of the theatres nearby.  The food is fast, you order it yourself but they bring it to your table.  They have lots of options, including snackpots which are mini tapas sized meals, burgers and the healthy option of salads.  I chose a salad which was very delicious.Great place to come if you are in a rush or looking for something cheap, you can also take food to go.
